newsitem.title: USA: Conn. atty genl says no to proposed bingo game.
newsitem.headline: Conn. atty genl says no to proposed bingo game.

text.p: Connecticut Attorney General Richard Blumenthal said Tuesday that a proposal for the Connecticut Lottery Corp to operate a bingo game would violate state law.
"Bingo games can only be operated by charitable groups that are specifically outlined in state law," Blumenthal said in a statement.
"The lottery is not permitted under current state law to promote or operate this type of game."
The Connecticut Lottery Corp had planned to initiate an on-line bingo game.
Connecticut started its lottery game about 25 years ago, under the State Division of Special Revenue.
The lottery is now managed by the Connecticut Lottery Corp, a quasi-public group set up in July of last year.
